alert.note: Alert for Henderson; Transylvania (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 27 at 8:52PM EDT until May 30 at 12:48AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in North Carolina... French Broad River At Blantyre affecting Henderson and Transylvania Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...French Broad River At Blantyre. * WHEN...Until early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...at 17.0 feet, floodwaters will continue to inundate farmland between the French Broad River and the railroad tracks and may start to inundate the shoulders of River Road near the Big Willow Road intersection. Floodwaters continue to impact boat access areas at Grove Bridge Road and Crab Creek Road. At 18.0 feet, The river may overtop the railroad tracks near Fodderstack Mountain Road and River Ridge Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:31 PM EDT Friday the stage was 17.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 18.5 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday afternoon. - Minor Flood Stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.5 feet on 01/08/1946. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. For detailed information including observed and forecast stages, flood impacts, flood history, FEMA Flood Hazard Layers, and more, please visit: https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp
